```{r opts, echo=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.width=8, fig.height=5)
```
# Introduction

```{r}
library(RCytoGPS)
data(cytoData)
ls()
summary(cytoData)
```

# Plotting Cytoband Data Along the Genome

```{r gb, fig.cap="Cytoband level data along the genome."}
opar <- par(mfrow=c(2,1))
genomeBarplot(cytoData$A.Loss, col="forestgreen")
genomeBarplot(cytoData$B.Loss, col="orange")
par(opar)
```

# Single Chromosome Plots
## Plotting Cytoband-Level Data Along One Chromosome
```{r v.plot2Chrom, fig.cap = "Stacked barplot of LGF frequencies on chromosome 3 for type A samples."}
plot1Chrom(cytoData, colnames(cytoData)[4:6], chr = 3)
```

```{r h.plot2Chrom, fig.cap = "Horizontal stacked barplot of LGF frequencies on chromosome 3 for type A samples."}
plot1Chrom(cytoData, colnames(cytoData)[4:6], chr = 3, horiz = TRUE)
```

## Plotting Cytoband-Level Data Along Both Sides of One Chromosome
```{r v.plot1Chrom, fig.cap = "Stacked barplot of LGF frequencies on chromosome 13 for type A and B samples."}
plot2Chrom(cytoData, "A.Loss", "B.Loss", chr = 13)
```

```{r h.plot1Chrom, fig.cap = "Horizontal stacked barplot of LGF frequencies on chromosome 13 for type A and B samples."}
plot2Chrom(cytoData, "A.Loss", "B.Loss", chr = 13, horiz = TRUE)
```

## Plotting LGF Summary Data Along One Chromosome

```{r singles, fig.cap = "Barplot of LGF frequency data along chromosome 6."}
singles(cytoData, c("A", "B", "C"), 6)
```

# Idiograms

## One Data Column
```{r makeid, fig.cap="Idiogram for one data columm."}
makeIdiogram(cytoData, "A.Loss", "orange")
```

## Contrasting Two Data Columns
```{r biid, fig.cap="Idiogram to contrast two data columms."}
biIdiogram(cytoData, "A.Loss", "A.Gain", pal=c("orange", "forestgreen"))
```

## Many Data Columns
```{r stackid, fig.cap="Idiogram for many data columns."}
stackIdiogram(cytoData, paste(LETTERS[1:3], "Loss", sep="."),
              pal=c("forestgreen", "orange", "purple"), nrows=3)
```
